website_summaries.verdict: This inline vent fan will run 50% quieter than its on-the-cheaper-end competition, and it’s a straightforward option for anyone who needs to ventilate an attic, basement, or bathroom.
pros: Easy-to-install via its four-foot power cord
cons: While this is an inexpensive inline vent fan, it is definitely noisier than a premium model would be

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting fan!
customer_reviews.text: Still my favorite air duct fan. This is my second purchase and I love it. Fairly quiet for a long time, after about a year or so I noticed both my fans started making more noise. Nothing huge, just a little extra noise is all. Pushes a lot of air at full speed and for the price you can't go wrong with this! I have had my fans for about 2 years now and one has been running 24/7 since the day it arrived at my house, the other has been off and on as I need it. Both work perfectly still, no signs of one getting weaker then the other or anything.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Works very well.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this installed for a couple of months now and it does exactly what I wanted it to do. The fan is a little loud but not unlike a floor fan blowing in the room. I purchased a temperature controlled plug that I mounted on the wall and plugged this unit into it. It allows the fan to run whenever the room gets warmer or cooler (depending on the setting) than the rest of the house, thus equalizing the temperature of the room with the temperature of the rest of the house. This product appears to be well built and designed for years of use. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Richard H. Porter

customer_reviews.title: Might work better in small spaces
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have much luck using this to pull the heat off my plant nursery. It also didn't seem to adjust speeds very well when used in conjunction with a voltage regulator; it basically runs full on or off. Depending on the size of your nursery and light wattage, you'll probably want something that moves at least double, if not, triple the volume of air per minute in your grow space. At least that's what ended up working for me.
customer_reviews.author: A. Wiederrich

customer_reviews.title: died young
customer_reviews.text: Barely over four months old and it is dead. I turned it off to move some things and it never turned back on. The blades were stiff to move so I oiled the bearing points and got the blades to move but the motor was completely dead ,not even a hum. It now adorns the trash.
customer_reviews.author: R. Brandenburg

customer_reviews.title: I hear the HUM and its annoying. This made more noise than I expected
customer_reviews.text: too loud. The noise of this fan is passed through a 25 foot duct tube purchased at Lowes, and so you hear this audible low hum. I only wanted to maybe hear NOTHING when wind comes out. I understand if wind makes some noise when it passes through the GRILL on the wall, but even when I take that off, I hear the HUM and its annoying. This made more noise than I expected!
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for awhile now and so far its been working perfectly. I have it in a 4x8 grow tent with a 1000w light. Keeps the temperature to where my thermostat is set as long as it isnt hot outside. Even in warmer weather i could just add a second one and im confident it would keep up. Somewhat noisy but not crazy loud.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Not as loud as other reviewers compained
customer_reviews.text: This is a lot more quiet than I thought it was going to be after listening to other reviews. It moves plenty of air, at a reasonable level, it doesn't vibrate to much, and I have been using another version of the one that I bought for almost 8 years now without issue which is why I bought another one! I put them in the window to pull in fresh air from outside, works perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Great Kitsune

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly strong
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this to help ventilate the air in my garage to lower humidity, As it was always a bit musty, and there was mold development in the far lower corners. Just hung this in the center of the garage, and attached a duct between it, and the vent in the attic. Can actually tell a significant difference after just half hour of running. It seems a bit loud to me, but as I said, it's just suspended near ceiling with only an exhaust duct attached. Sure it wouldn't be so bad if properly installed.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer VanHuss

customer_reviews.title: bathroom exhauster
customer_reviews.text: the picture showed seemed like a cheap design ,mounting a fan inside a sheetmetal 6" tube 8"long result NOISE. The power cord provided is long enough to plug in a GFCI or the option of hardwiring to a box with switch, I had this mounted between the wall of bathroom and pantry which was exactly 8" wide.,electrical connection with a switch and box separately,nice grill on the inside and exhaust outsde 4" dryer vent,works cool. I thought mounting between walls will dampen noise but it did not. Compared with the Homedepot/Lowes stulff this is far better in exhausting a bathroom under 100 sf.
customer_reviews.author: Job T. Ittoop

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fan for our ducting needs!
customer_reviews.text: We are using this fan in the wall between our boiler room and garage to remove the extra heat from the boiler room and we added a thermostat that has it come on when when that room gets too hot. This use is a little different than what the product is intended for, but certainly is perfect for our situation. We placed it high near the ceiling so as not to be a hazard for fingers. We are looking on the web to find a screen cover for each end - then it will be perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Merrill

customer_reviews.title: Good but Loud
customer_reviews.text: This inline fans does exactly what it is supposed to. I have two tube lights in series and this fan keeps them cool enough that I don't expect any more scorched leaves. Also, if you use 400 w + lights, the bulbs won't last very long if you don't cool them.( Thank me for an expensive lesson). My primary complaint is the noise. The thing sounds like a Pegasus taking off! Fortunately my facility is not near anything. On the plus side, this fan moves lots of air without any bulb-killing vibration.
customer_reviews.author: BJ

customer_reviews.title: Moves the air pretty well
customer_reviews.text: I bought a fan that replaced the register, but it did little to help anything. This Inline fan however, made a noticeable difference. It's a little noisey, but much quieter than the "computer fan" type thing I had before. Would recommend. It could be quieter if the manufacturer actually put 2 seconds of thought into the blade design, but it works and my son's room is cooler now.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Clompett

customer_reviews.title: Excellent exhaust fan
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to put in a 6" line of single layer galvanized vent pipe. I BBQ and smoke in my shed in winter and I have a sheet metal hood that this fan sits on top of and vents out through the wall. If you are looking for an inexpensive fan to use to vent food exhaust or any other, this is a good buy. Works much better than a typical bathroom exhaust fan. it moves about 5 times the cubic feet of air per minute. All metal fan is a bonus too versus plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Redbo

customer_reviews.title: IT works.
customer_reviews.text: IT'S A GOOD EXHAUST FAN... it works. It does push good air but it's noisy and sometimes you don't want a wheezing in your ear all the time. So yea, nice fan; but the casing could be made to be more quiet. I took care of it by wrapping it with black pipe foam covers. Worked great as a silencer. thanks.
customer_reviews.author: johnny pichardo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the job
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this fan specifically as a booster for my bedroom air conditioning. The room was a 350sq/f addition to a 1300 sq/f home. The six inch insulated flex hose is 25 ft long from the main to the bedroom vent. Path of least resistance didn't allow the room to cool. I installed this fan between the flex hose and the outlet cut into the main distribution box in the attic where the hose was installed. My bedroom cooled from 85 degrees to 70 degrees in one hour. Tons of air flow with absolutely no noise at all. If you have a long stretch of duct work that the air or heat wont flow through then go for it. Awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Gray

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again
customer_reviews.text: Had one of these running for 8 years 24/7. For $20 what more could you ask? Buying a new one today
customer_reviews.author: Steve McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Speed controller won't work with this fan
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. It says you can use a speed controller but it doesn't function correctly. It will only work at 80% and above or it will just sit and hum. The main reason I purchased this one was because I thought speed could be controlled. Its very loud
customer_reviews.author: Zoyla Cervantes

customer_reviews.title: It really sucks good
customer_reviews.text: This fan is great we built our own a/c unit out of a cooler and dry ice that we swap out with big ice hugs and we are using this fan as a means to push the cold air out and it's working wonderfully in conjunction to another vent fan we added I'm not disappointed at all
customer_reviews.author: Tai's Amazing Profile

customer_reviews.title: Mount it to the supply trunk! Not the ceiling register.
customer_reviews.text: I put this fan at the ceiling register. Not a good place. It was noisy in the room and did not push any air through due to the 6" duct only supplying 75cfm to a fan that can push 240cfm. I moved it to the supply trunk so it had more volume behind it and hooked up the duct. Blows air great into the room.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Brackett

customer_reviews.title: Too bad it seems sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Noisy...vibrates, way too much fan blade noise for a home environment. Does not fit standard 6 inch duct. 15 minutes of tin knocking made it fit. Too bad it seems sturdy...for a home I’d pass on this one
customer_reviews.author: NHDan

customer_reviews.title: It sucks--and that is a good thing.
customer_reviews.text: Really moves a lot of air. Using it for radon remediation in my basement. It reduced the amount from 22pU to under 2pU (for those who don't know, that is incredible. The only reason for not getting 5 stars is that it is not silent. If someone made a silent fan with this kind of muscle, it would be a home run. Still, the whirring sound is not all that noticeable unless you lean your ears to the air registers.
customer_reviews.author: Nevadaflyboy

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!  Junk! and no customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy unless you want to replace it every 60 days. This thing worked for 60 days... one month past the time to return it. It died after only modest use. Amazon should be ashamed to sell this junk or at least be willing to replace an item that stops working after 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: MauiShadow

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these and I've been very happy with them. They're quiet, move a lot of air, and ... Well, that's about all I'm looking for. I think I might get one for my range hood vent now that I know how quiet they are, the fan up there now sounds like a jet taking off. Keep your fingers out of the metal blades and you'll be all set with these.
customer_reviews.author: Jer

customer_reviews.title: Heat is moving again
customer_reviews.text: Use for long distant travel to guess room; Works great!!
customer_reviews.author: Edwin E. Kemp Jr

customer_reviews.title: Powerful but noisy
customer_reviews.text: Like so many other reviewers have said, “very powerful, but noisy.” I liked the fact that it already had a power cable already attached, but if I had to go through all the trouble of putting it in my attic, I decided to get a much quieter fan, play electrician, got a real inline fan, ran the necessary vent tubes, and spiced power. Quieter, more power, less money.
customer_reviews.author: Anita

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive relief
customer_reviews.text: As any person buying a home should know, if you didn't have any say in the build, you will get what the contractor decides on. In most cases, the materials and appliances will barely meet code; especially heating and cooling units. This is why I made this purchase. Though it is quite noisy, this duct booster has made my upstairs room is significantly cooler.
customer_reviews.author: shave

customer_reviews.title: Moves Air However Loud
customer_reviews.text: I read the other reviews regarding the loudness of this unit and thought that it can't be that bad. Perhaps most of the noise was from vibration. Boy was my thoughts wrong. The fan cutting through the air is what makes the noise and the noise is loud. I would not recommend this unit to be installed in an area that will be occupied by anyone with good hearing. The whooshing hum sound is very annoying. However this little thing will move some air. One other note: The one I received was undersized (5 - 13/16") Diameter. Which makes for a sloppy fit when using 6" Galvanized pipe.
customer_reviews.author: Doober

customer_reviews.title: SUPER LOUD AND NOT A LOT OF CFM
customer_reviews.text: This fan is louder than it should be and uses quite a bit of electricity. I would recommend another brand. This unit operates around 72+ Db.
customer_reviews.author: Higher Standards

customer_reviews.title: ALRIGHT!
customer_reviews.text: This little guy works great especially for the price.The cfm rivals that of other very expensive fans in the 100$ range has been running for over two months straight and is still going strong usuing it to cool a 400w HPS and it works like a charm.Have unplugged and plugged in about 30 times when i first got it just to see if it would burn out,and no issues so far.I am very pleased with this fan and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: zach

customer_reviews.title: What more can I say
customer_reviews.text: It moves quite a bit of air, is relatively energy efficient, and is inexpensive. A few of the screws were loose, and could've caused some trouble if I hadn't caught it. Is is pretty loud; you can hear it throughout the apartment. I've been satisfied so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great fan at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this inline fan to go with a length of 6" flexible duct to carry air-conditioned air down the steps into my basement during summer, so I could work down there. The combination worked superbly; the fan is powerful, not too noisy, and very reliable thus far (sometimes running continuously for 3 days; in operation now for ~ 2 months). It nested tightly into the ducting with only a wrap or two of "duck tape". I'm very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Godwin-austen

customer_reviews.title: Does a fine job. Have this at beginning of duct run ...
customer_reviews.text: Does a fine job. Have this at beginning of duct run and another at end of run. Wood stove is in basement at one end of house and flex duct runs to living room at other end. Moves air quite well ( close to 30' ) with just one on(when its not that cold).
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Jorgensen Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Great quite fan
customer_reviews.text: This fan is very quiet and moves a lot of air. It is very well built and fits in the grow tent exhaust perfectly. When we upgrade tents we will add more of these.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Dietrich

customer_reviews.title: Air moving
customer_reviews.text: Great little cost effective way to help your central heating/cooling do its job. A little noisy, but I'd wire them independent if your system, so you can use them at peak times and turn off when normal heating/cooling is sufficient. Update - reduced rating to 3 stars because one fan (out of 4) has already failed after not 3 full months installed, and no available way to contact seller for replacement.
customer_reviews.author: DaveF

customer_reviews.title: A word of caution about "controllers"
customer_reviews.text: After a few months on a 'quality' motor controller, this motor crapped out on me. Too late to do anything about it, but I will take it to an electric motor tech for analysis. Worked great, while it worked... Can't recommend unless no controller is involved.
customer_reviews.author: Al Anon

customer_reviews.title: does not suck
customer_reviews.text: It blows when the heat sensitive switch I installed on it reaches100 degrees and goes off at 85. Not too loud for my garage. all metal construction is a plus. Not really using it for it's advertised purpose, so can't comment on how well it is as a duct booster, but it seems like it would be fine for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: D. Ballard

customer_reviews.title: Moves air
customer_reviews.text: No issues. Using it in a home system and is a little noisy, but most of that air is coming through the duct. Tried to control the air output with a Duct Fan Speed Adjuster I also purchased, but it did not provide any real control of the fan (fan would just stop when you tried to slow it down). If you are going to use this fan, plan on running it at the speed it turns at and be able to accept some noise. If using it in a Hydroponic garden, I suspect you would be fully satisified.
customer_reviews.author: Benhere

customer_reviews.title: Good deal - moderate to light noise IMO..
customer_reviews.text: Working great in Outdoor grow house. Good price compared to nearby stores... Makes noise, but can barely hear it outside the pole shed..
customer_reviews.author: Robert Martey, RNR

customer_reviews.title: good quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: This fan pushes a pretty good amount of air. The only downside is needing to wire it to kick on when the furnace kicks on not just to run constant with the plug. This may not be an issue when using the AC instead of the heat.
customer_reviews.author: paul j profit

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Noise is nominal compared to others that cost 3 times as much (or more). When used with a variable speed control the noise is gone. Works great for cooling indoor growing room as well as pulling air through a carbon filter. Been running 24/7 for 5 months, just ordered a 2nd one.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stephen Hartsfield

customer_reviews.title: Great quality at a fair price
customer_reviews.text: I heat a two story pool house with a pellet stove. So that hot air doesn't get trapped at the peak of the cathedral ceiling I have a flexable duct which comes from the ceiling peak and discharges at the floor with the help of this inline duct fan. The one I had previously had a plastic fan blade, it was quiter then this inline duct fan but this one is much more robust. I am extreamly satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: James G. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Died pretty quick but got it hot
customer_reviews.text: Well it was an ok fan but for sure it does not handle heat well. Just make sure you do not get it too hot so it can't really be used on a hot air output line. Other than that is was ok. Died pretty quick but got it hot.
customer_reviews.author: David Meier

customer_reviews.title: Didnt work out for me
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 2 of them both dead less than 10 hours use
customer_reviews.author: christopher c cefalo

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. A little noisy, but not bad. Pushes air well enough.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to
customer_reviews.text: It does a good job of moving a lot of air, but it also generates quite a bit of noise. Some other reviews mentioned the need for some assembly when they received their fan. For what it's worth, mine came fully assembled. It's been doing its job for a few months now without any problems. If noise isn't an issue for you, then this is one of the cheapest options you'll find.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Effective but not subtle.
customer_reviews.text: This fan MOVES AIR, much more then I was expecting actually. It is important to note though that it is not very quiet. While it is not loud enough to be heard through a wall or from outside it is distinctly noticeable if you are in the same room as it. If sound is not a concern then this fan is easily a 5 out of 5 as the value and efficiency of this thing is impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Noisy
customer_reviews.text: The fan lasted 2 years It is noisy when installed a booster fan I installed a speed control to adjust the flow
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality fan , I installed it in the top of my car and now I can go faster !!!!
customer_reviews.author: gus

customer_reviews.title: Just as described
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat these for the price. They do what they say they do, and I would buy more if I needed to. I ended up using these to make non-powered vents into powered vents in my attic. They work like they're supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I was afraid that after a while it would burn but it's been almost a year running it everyday day for 12 hours and still nice and quit. Maybe I got lucky but I recommend it. I hooked it up with a dimmer and it verily heats up a little.
customer_reviews.author: onesolo

customer_reviews.title: Works Great.  I use it for venting a small generator in a box.
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. The sound you hear is air moving which is not that bad. I like the rigidness and all metal structure. I made a box to house my honda generator eu2000i and am using this vent to bring in fresh air and expell the exhaust gas. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Sound Guy

customer_reviews.title: LED GYO240 6 inch 240 CMF
customer_reviews.text: Great little fan. Its now been running since I had the fan 24/7 with no issues. Pick one up if you need a good metal blade booster fan far better than those plastic blades I assure you.
customer_reviews.author: tracker258

customer_reviews.title: Great inline fan on a budget
customer_reviews.text: I order this ta use with a 600w hps cooltube setup.Does a great job keeping the air moving.I don't like the fact that I gotta get a fan control for it,but hey for the price,it will work.I would order another one.
customer_reviews.author: Eskimo Joe

customer_reviews.title: amazing
customer_reviews.text: so i read alot of the reviews and thought for 25$ what the hell. works amazing i have a 11ft tall room and keeping it warm was a hard took 5min to install and room changed for 62 to 71 in 3 hours. amazing product even if it only last a year ill get my moneys worth already ordered another one. thanks
customer_reviews.author: eric

customer_reviews.title: It blows air!!!
customer_reviews.text: All you have to do is plug it in, turn it on and the little blades turn real fast and violet... you got windage. Not the most powerful, but does ok for the price and don't make much noise yet...
customer_reviews.author: DMAC

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: we have a vent right above are stove but nothing to force the air out. This did the trick, fit snug in the existing pipe. Great temporary fix till I get a chance to install the permanent ventilation. Great for what I needed it to do.
customer_reviews.author: John Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Built great
customer_reviews.text: The booster is built very good. I rated the product low because its not living up to my expectations. I have the fan before a T connection and figured i would push a lot more are out of dual registers. Not really the case air flow increased a little but nothing dramatic. I will give it another month and may pull it out of my duct run. No need to use electricity if its not going to push more that i want. I was wishful thinking. I would work well in a single duct run but not in split run.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Way better than most other fans for the same price
customer_reviews.text: Way better than most other fans for the same price. I bought this one and the ipower brand. This one is way better.
customer_reviews.author: Harrison Swift

customer_reviews.title: Good value fan.
customer_reviews.text: Great fan for the money. Comes with a cord attached ready to go. Moves a fare amount of air. Sounds level is fairly quiet for its size but not silent.
customer_reviews.author: Scott R.

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat noisy, but moves a lot of air.
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a duct boost fan to get HVAC to a distant part of my house. It moves A LOT of air, but not very quietly. I have a duct stat that I have set to start this up when the heater or AC goes on, and that drowns this fan out.
customer_reviews.author: Jud V

customer_reviews.title: Fan pulls air fairly fast
customer_reviews.text: for the money this fan is great ,i have been using two{in seperate places}for over a year with no problem.Only complaint is the fan wasnt made for a quite setting ,it is a little loud if it is in the room with you
customer_reviews.author: 8ight6ix

customer_reviews.title: what i expected for the price
customer_reviews.text: as I have read in other reviews, this fan is a bit noisy, but once you see the price of other fans that are quiet and will still put out the same cfm, this fan is a real bargain, I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: kevina

customer_reviews.title: It moves a lot of Air
customer_reviews.text: This thing works, it moves a ton of air for a fan it's size. It is loud when you plug it in and hold it in your hands, but once installed in your attic, all I hear is more air coming out of the vent. It makes a world of difference.
customer_reviews.author: A. Crochet

customer_reviews.title: Great fan for a good price
customer_reviews.text: This is not a very loud fan, I have it set up for venting my small grow tent in my bath room next to my bed room sounds like a small table fan when installed. This fan works awesome.
customer_reviews.author: rm250

customer_reviews.title: A little too loud
customer_reviews.text: If the sound of the motor is going to bother you then you will need to move this device at least 10 or 15 feet away from the register. I wish it had a speed control and maybe that would have helped.
customer_reviews.author: Franco

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Fan
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little fan. Mine came with the included power cord already attached. Not sure if this is a recent change or if the other below received his unwired accidentally. I used this as a duct booster for my forced air furnace. The ducts in our house were run 80 years after the house was constructed so they are definitely not ideal. With this little fan, I finally have enough volume of air entering our bedroom that we don't have to run the central air and our window A/C both! Great buy, seems durable. Will absolutely update if it breaks, but no news means it keeps running!
customer_reviews.author: Morgen F. Benner

customer_reviews.title: Very Bad fan
customer_reviews.text: I had this 240CFM Air Fan for 1 month and it died does not work and i can not return it. The sad thing is other customers beware this fan is junk ..
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey labonte

customer_reviews.title: Loud but runs like no other booster fan
customer_reviews.text: Quick shipment from seller. Fan however had cosmetic damage when received (looked like fan was dropped on an edge). Like others have said this fan is loud. Almost as loud as my 6" inline fan. That being said, it moves a lot of air for its size and price. I see how it could cool a 600w lamp however its internal wiring is right behind the fan (no external housing) and could be an issue if pulling air from a hot source. Mine came pre-wired. The outside metal shell is flexible, I had to bend one end a bit to fit the ducting before installation.
customer_reviews.author: DocAnoctopus

customer_reviews.title: ...still going strong 24/7 after 18 months.
customer_reviews.text: I was seeking reliability / long life. I set this blower to feed into a custom plenum; system has vastly improved my heat exchange and lowered required compressor run times ...blower still going strong 24/7 after 18 months.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Shinnick

customer_reviews.title: air duct
customer_reviews.text: this blower works great and came with the light for a very reasonable price it h=keeps the light cool so no issues with that
customer_reviews.author: Deb Phipps

customer_reviews.title: not very powerful
customer_reviews.text: It works fine but does not move the amount of air I was thinking it would. The bathroom fan in my house blows more air than this! It is well built, over sized electric cord, but that is a plus, maybe...
customer_reviews.author: KM Stevens

customer_reviews.title: ... run this fan for a while and it works great.
customer_reviews.text: I have run this fan for a while and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Stefania

customer_reviews.title: waste of money
customer_reviews.text: It burned out within a week of use. Don't waste your money. I took a chance because it was cheap...you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: AdrianaMF

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this fan for 3 years without a problem. I dont know how well its working compared to when it was new, but hey.. it works.
customer_reviews.author: BKBTX

customer_reviews.title: great fans
customer_reviews.text: these fans are pretty good fans fairly quiet when running during summertime had it running constantly for about 3 months and it never gave me any problems so i ordered 2 more
customer_reviews.author: tritan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Has more power than I expected from a 6 inch fan..... up close its kind of noisy
customer_reviews.author: Silas

customer_reviews.title: Works like it should
customer_reviews.text: I have not had any issues with this product so far. It's been running for a couple of weeks. It's not super loud and it definitely moves some air. For the price, this can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: John Calchera

customer_reviews.title: Works good!
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive duct fan that blows a good amount of air. I used one of these to vent heat out of a heat exchanger for a little while and it did the job pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: J. Michael

customer_reviews.title: Strong fan, very noisy
customer_reviews.text: The fan pushes quite a bit of air and fits nicely in a 6" duct. Came ready to go out of box. I vastly underestimated it's noise though! I bought to put in a 5x3x3 tent in my room and it was way too loud for this purpose. If noise isn't an issue, go for it, otherwise you'll need to invest more
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: inline fan
customer_reviews.text: was shipped out very fast and good package. it was already wired when i opened it up and just plug and play. i have run it constant since i have had it and no problems at all...and thats over a week so far..so for the money great product and will do great with 6 inch air ducting to get w/e you want out of the room
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Matthew Brown

customer_reviews.title: no power
customer_reviews.text: 240 CFM sounds good, but when you install into you air duck, it make no difference (improvement). I toke it out and put in my "junk" box in garage.
customer_reviews.author: Texaschang

customer_reviews.title: Works well for me
customer_reviews.text: I'm pleased with this duct booster fan. It puts out plenty of air and has a nice long cord. A good value for the price and I recommend it if you need a fan of medium airflow and pressure. Don't expect a lot from it, some duct installations need a lot of power and this booster is of medium power. If you need HIGH power for your duct installation, I have one of these 1/4 HP 1575CFM blower fans in service and I highly recommend it as an awesome value in high CFM duct blowers.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia Sun

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: What absolute garbage. I actually got more air flow without it. Belongs in the trash
customer_reviews.author: Riley

customer_reviews.title: blown away!
customer_reviews.text: i bought this to move the heat from my wood stove to my master bed room it was well worth the money as it moves alot of air very happy
customer_reviews.author: donald

customer_reviews.title: So so,..
customer_reviews.text: It is Ok, did not work with the speed controller I bought....not quiet. Mike in Tacoma
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wade Phillips

customer_reviews.title: 6" fan
customer_reviews.text: This fan cured our problem of elevated temperatures in the addition we added. It is now the coldest room in the house. I leave the fan running 24/7. i have it in flex duct approximately 5ft from the vent. You can't hear it.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hanson

customer_reviews.title: worked great! Matched with a dryer vent and am very ...
customer_reviews.text: Used as a vent fan for chicken coop, worked great! Matched with a dryer vent and am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: BLarson

customer_reviews.title: two months
customer_reviews.text: Going 24/7 for past two months. Seems to be working great. Use to vent heat out of greenhouse. Good value. Fast delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: costumer service
customer_reviews.text: Fan burnt out within a couple days and LED customer service was not accommodating. Suggest checking your options just in case. It was $35 out the window because it's hard to get a refund or exchange across the country. I wish I would have dealt with a local company. Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: johnnyti

customer_reviews.title: LED Wholesalers ROCKS! Mulptiple time customer!
customer_reviews.text: Love these guys prices and products. Function over cosmetics. It does what it needs to and I didn't have to pay a bunch for an over priced fancy housing.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew L Queen

customer_reviews.title: this sucker moves a lot of air
customer_reviews.text: It efficiently cools my 600W non-vented HPS light inside of an enclosed tent. The suction around the vent hole is extremely noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: Bren

customer_reviews.title: I use it to cool down my crawlspace so my servers stay happy and ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing blows some serious air. I use it to cool down my crawlspace so my servers stay happy and this thing does the job
customer_reviews.author: TheFuzz4

customer_reviews.title: Good purchas
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this to pull out fumes from a styrofoam cutting line. Is quiet and powerfull. Easy to install using the aluminum foil ducts.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco F. Fuentes

customer_reviews.title: Efficient, quiet enough
customer_reviews.text: It functions as advertised. I'm using it as a basement vent to minimize radon build-up, and it seems to be effective.
customer_reviews.author: D. Cushman

customer_reviews.title: ... it to move air through a metal sieve to cool coffee beans after roasting
customer_reviews.text: I use it to move air through a metal sieve to cool coffee beans after roasting. Works great.

customer_reviews.text: These are a must when linking multiple hid lights in a row. And great for just moving air around ur room

customer_reviews.title: Decent fan
customer_reviews.text: for the price and size it performs quite well. I use it as a booster fan. Does just what I needed it to.

customer_reviews.title: quiet at first
customer_reviews.text: fan was great at first but as it runs it vibrates, it has a harmonic frequency that I can hear though out the whole house(2Ksqft),will not recomend
customer_reviews.author: james martin

customer_reviews.title: Puts out a lot of air
customer_reviews.text: This fan works great. It is strong enough to circulate air in my tent which is 48"x24"x60". It is a little noisy but that can be brought down by putting it in ducting.

customer_reviews.title: Loud
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to move some air around. It did work but it's so loud it never gets used. So I guess it would depend on what your buying it for.
customer_reviews.author: joel

product_meta.title: LEDwholesalers 6-Inch 240 CFM Air Duct Inline Hydroponic Booster Fan,GYO2402
product_meta.description: Boost air flow in long duct runs with this inline duct fan. Constructed of all metal, this fan is effective and efficient. All metal construction (including the blades) Light weight 240 CFM 4 feet power cord 120V, 60Hz Discreet packaging Installation Instructions: * Loosen a screw on the outside of the housing. * Secure GREEN wire to the housing with the screw. * Other two wires can be randomly paired up with wires from motor. * Line up the bare ends of each pair of wires; twist the bare ends CLOCKWISE with fingers; put wire nut on and again twist CLOCKWISE until tight. * Hold wire nut in one hand and tuck on each wire to confirm that they are secure.
feature_bullets: Light weight Air flow :Max. air flow 266CFM
